q: Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.
h:
“Love and compassion are necessities, not luxuries. Without them, humanity cannot survive.” —
Dalai Lama

q: All you need is passion. If you have a passion for something, you'll create the talent.
h:
“All you need is passion. If you have a passion for something, you'll create the talent.” —
Yanni

q: Having an open mind is one of the most important qualities we can possess. Once our minds close, we stop evolving.
h:
“Having an open mind is one of the most important qualities we can possess. Once our minds close, we stop evolving.” —
Yanni

q: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
h:
“If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.” —
Mother Teresa

q: What we know is a drop, what we don't know is an ocean.
h:
“What we know is a drop, what we don't know is an ocean. ” —
Isaac Newton

q: The first half of life is devoted to forming a healthy ego, the second half is going inward and letting go of it.
h:
“The first half of life is devoted to forming a healthy ego, the second half is going inward and letting go of it.” —
Carl Jung

q: There is no right or wrong, only a series of possibilities that shift with each thought, feeling, and action that you experience.
h:
“There is no right or wrong, only a series of possibilities that shift with each thought, feeling, and action that you experience.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
h:
“When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Greatest success comes just one step beyond the point at which defeat overtakes you.
h:
“Greatest success comes just one step beyond the point at which defeat overtakes you.” —
Unknown

q: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
h:
“If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.” —
Lao Tzu

q: I take the position that I'm always to some degree wrong, and the aspiration is to be less wrong.
h:
“I take the position that I'm always to some degree wrong, and the aspiration is to be less wrong.” —
Elon Musk

q: Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.
h:
“Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.
h:
“Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.” —
Robin Sharma

q: The more we value things, the less we value ourselves.
h:
“The more we value things, the less we value ourselves. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Reality is the leading cause of stress among those in touch with it.
h:
“Reality is the leading cause of stress among those in touch with it.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: The past has no power over the present moment.
h:
“The past has no power over the present moment. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: The only limits in your life are those that you set yourself.
h:
“The only limits in your life are those that you set yourself.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
h:
“Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: You have the potential for greatness.
h:
“You have the potential for greatness.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Not why the addiction but why the pain.
h:
“Not why the addiction but why the pain.” —
Gabor Mate

q: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
h:
“We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Life can be wonderful if you're not afraid of it.
h:
“Life can be wonderful if you're not afraid of it.” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: Where words fail, music speaks.
h:
“Where words fail, music speaks.” —
Hans Christian Andersen

q: Everything starts with a dream. A particle of our imagination that teases us of what the future could be like, as long as we fight for it.
h:
“Everything starts with a dream. A particle of our imagination that teases us of what the future could be like, as long as we fight for it.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: Either get busy living or get busy dying.
h:
“Either get busy living or get busy dying.” —
Stephen King

q: Each of us is a unique strand in the intricate web of life and here to make a contribution.
h:
“Each of us is a unique strand in the intricate web of life and here to make a contribution.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.
h:
“No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.” —
Aristotle

q: FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.
h:
“FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.
h:
“If you can handle rejection, you'll learn to get everything you want.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.
h:
“Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.” —
Dan Brown

q: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.
h:
“A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise. ” —
Buddha

q: We must not be afraid of dreaming the seemingly impossible if we want the seemingly impossible to become a reality.
h:
“We must not be afraid of dreaming the seemingly impossible if we want the seemingly impossible to become a reality.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: When you make a choice, you change the future.
h:
“When you make a choice, you change the future.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: We're kept from our goal not by obstacles, but by a clear path to a lesser goal.
h:
“We're kept from our goal not by obstacles, but by a clear path to a lesser goal.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.
h:
“If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: If light is in your heart, you will find your way home.
h:
“If light is in your heart, you will find your way home. ” —
Rumi

q: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.
h:
“Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: If fear is too strong, the genius is suppressed.
h:
“If fear is too strong, the genius is suppressed.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: May you live all the days of your life.
h:
“May you live all the days of your life.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: You don't get in life what you want; you get in life what you are.
h:
“You don't get in life what you want; you get in life what you are.” —
Les Brown

q: The price of inaction is far greater than the cost of making a mistake.
h:
“The price of inaction is far greater than the cost of making a mistake.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.
h:
“Men are anxious to improve their circumstances but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.” —
James Allen

q: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
h:
“Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.
h:
“Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Living life in style also means living a life of balance.
h:
“Living life in style also means living a life of balance.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The day is for honest men, the night for thieves.
h:
“The day is for honest men, the night for thieves.” —
Euripides

q: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
h:
“Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.
h:
“Make no small plans for they have no power to stir the soul.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
h:
“Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.” —
Helen Keller

q: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
h:
“Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.” —
Babe Ruth

q: Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.
h:
“Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.” —
Og Mandino

q: A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.
h:
“A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction.” —
Criss Jami

q: Success is a poor teacher.
h:
“Success is a poor teacher.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: I never said it would be easy, I only said it would be worth it.
h:
“I never said it would be easy, I only said it would be worth it.” —
Mae West

q: Don't shortchange yourself when it comes to investing in your own better future.
h:
“Don't shortchange yourself when it comes to investing in your own better future.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.
h:
“The more tranquil a man becomes, the greater is his success, his influence, his power for good. Calmness of mind is one of the beautiful jewels of wisdom.” —
James Allen

q: Invisible things are the only realities.
h:
“Invisible things are the only realities.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.
h:
“If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Life and the simple beauty of it is too good to pass up.
h:
“Life and the simple beauty of it is too good to pass up.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
h:
“Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Your purpose will be clear only when you listen to your heart.
h:
“Your purpose will be clear only when you listen to your heart.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: The greatest miracle is to be alive.
h:
“The greatest miracle is to be alive.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: You can avoid reality, but you cannot avoid the consequences of avoiding reality.
h:
“You can avoid reality, but you cannot avoid the consequences of avoiding reality.” —
Ayn Rand

q: My definition of success is control.
h:
“My definition of success is control.” —
Kenneth Branagh

q: Dreams have only one owner at a time. That's why dreamers are lonely.
h:
“Dreams have only one owner at a time. That's why dreamers are lonely.” —
William Faulkner

q: Whether you think you can or think you can't – you are right.
h:
“Whether you think you can or think you can't – you are right.” —
Henry Ford

q: The purpose of life is to contribute in some way to making things better.
h:
“The purpose of life is to contribute in some way to making things better.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
h:
“Never spend your money before you have earned it.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
h:
“A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Art is the signature of civilizations.
h:
“Art is the signature of civilizations. ” —
Beverly Sills

q: Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure.
h:
“Do not stop thinking of life as an adventure.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: A good system shortens the road to the goal.
h:
“A good system shortens the road to the goal. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.
h:
“Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
h:
“Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: Everything great that has ever happened to humanity has begun as a single thought in someone's mind.
h:
“Everything great that has ever happened to humanity has begun as a single thought in someone's mind.” —
Yanni

q: Your problem isn't the problem. Your reaction is the problem.
h:
“Your problem isn't the problem. Your reaction is the problem.” —
Unknown

q: Show kindness but never expect it. Show authenticity but never expect it. Only the wise are indifferent to things they can't control.
h:
“Show kindness but never expect it. Show authenticity but never expect it. Only the wise are indifferent to things they can't control.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Even when a friend does something you do not like, he continues to be your friend.
h:
“Even when a friend does something you do not like, he continues to be your friend. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.
h:
“When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.
h:
“Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.” —
Robert Frost

q: If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.
h:
“If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.
h:
“If there's a definition of freedom, I think it's this: living life on your terms.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.
h:
“Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.
h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life.” —
Steve Jobs

q: There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.
h:
“There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Use your smile to change the world but don't let the world change your smile.
h:
“Use your smile to change the world but don't let the world change your smile.” —
Unknown

q: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
h:
“Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Being in a good frame of mind helps keep one in the picture of health.
h:
“Being in a good frame of mind helps keep one in the picture of health.” —
Unknown

q: All problems are illusions of the mind.
h:
“All problems are illusions of the mind.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: People have the illusion that all over the world, all the time, all kinds of fantastic things are happening.
h:
“People have the illusion that all over the world, all the time, all kinds of fantastic things are happening.” —
David Brinkley

q: Let us rather run the risk of wearing out than rusting out.
h:
“Let us rather run the risk of wearing out than rusting out.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Mistake is a mistake only if you make it twice.
h:
“Mistake is a mistake only if you make it twice.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Never was anything great achieved without danger.
h:
“Never was anything great achieved without danger.” —
Niccolo Machiavelli

q: Walk slowly but never walk backward.
h:
“Walk slowly but never walk backward.” —
Unknown

q: No matter how much preparation we do, in the real tests of our lives, we'll be in unfamiliar terrain.
h:
“No matter how much preparation we do, in the real tests of our lives, we'll be in unfamiliar terrain.” —

q: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
h:

q: Life is trying things to see if they work.
h:
“Life is trying things to see if they work.” —

q: Seek not the good in external things;seek it in yourselves.
h:
“Seek not the good in external things;seek it in yourselves.” —

q: Thoughts become things. If you see it in your mind, you will hold it in your hand.
h:
“Thoughts become things. If you see it in your mind, you will hold it in your hand.” —
Bob Proctor

q: We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.
h:
“We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.” —

q: I will not walk backward in life.
h:
“I will not walk backward in life.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Some of the greater things in life are unseen; that's why you close your eyes when you kiss, cry, or dream.
h:
“Some of the greater things in life are unseen; that's why you close your eyes when you kiss, cry, or dream.” —
Unknown

q: It's not about what it is, it's about what it can become.
h:
“It's not about what it is, it's about what it can become.” —
Dr. Seuss

q: Procrastination is attitude's natural assassin. There's nothing so fatiguing as an uncompleted task.
h:
“Procrastination is attitude's natural assassin. There's nothing so fatiguing as an uncompleted task.” —
William James

q: The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.
h:
“The less people know, the more stubbornly they know it.” —
Osho

q: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
h:
“Life is too important to be taken seriously.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.
h:
“There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Sometimes adversity is what you need to face in order to become successful.
h:
“Sometimes adversity is what you need to face in order to become successful.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.
h:
“Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.
h:
“Riches don't make a man rich, they only make him busier.” —
Christopher Columbus

q: Nothing like a health problem to turn up the contrast dial for the rest of life.
h:
“Nothing like a health problem to turn up the contrast dial for the rest of life.” —

q: Good entrepreneurs don't fail because they stay at it.
h:
“Good entrepreneurs don't fail because they stay at it.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.” —

q: The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.
h:
“The more you take responsibility for your past and present, the more you are able to create the future you seek.” —

q: All you need is passion. If you have a passion for something, you'll create the talent.
h:
“All you need is passion. If you have a passion for something, you'll create the talent.” —
Yanni

q: The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.
h:
“The right thing to do and the hard thing to do are usually the same.” —

q: If the grass is greener on the other side, maybe that's because you're not taking good care of your grass.
h:
“If the grass is greener on the other side, maybe that's because you're not taking good care of your grass.” —
Unknown

q: The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.
h:
“The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.” —
Socrates

q: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised.
h:
“Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: The salvation of the world lies in the human heart.
h:
“The salvation of the world lies in the human heart.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: If you aim at nothing, you will hit it every time.
h:
“If you aim at nothing, you will hit it every time. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: A hero is an ordinary person doing things in an extra ordinary way.
h:
“A hero is an ordinary person doing things in an extra ordinary way.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.
h:
“Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see the shadows.” —
Helen Keller

q: Greatness comes from living with purpose and passion.
h:
“Greatness comes from living with purpose and passion.” —
Ralph Marston

q: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
h:
“It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.” —
Epictetus

q: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
h:
“Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.” —
John D. Rockefeller

q: You are never too old to become younger.
h:
“You are never too old to become younger.” —
Mae West

q: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
h:
“Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.” —
Charles Dickens

q: To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.
h:
“To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: I would rather be hated for who I am than loved for who I'm not.
h:
“I would rather be hated for who I am than loved for who I'm not. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.
h:
“No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart.
h:
“Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Whatever you decide to do, make sure it makes you happy.
h:
“Whatever you decide to do, make sure it makes you happy.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.
h:
“The law of harvest is to reap more than you sow. Sow an act, and you reap a habit. Sow a habit and you reap a character. Sow a character and you reap a destiny.” —
James Allen

q: Your heart is full of fertile seeds, waiting to sprout.
h:
“Your heart is full of fertile seeds, waiting to sprout.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: Death is as sure for that which is born, as birth is for that which is dead. Therefore grieve not for what is inevitable.
h:
“Death is as sure for that which is born, as birth is for that which is dead. Therefore grieve not for what is inevitable.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Success is about creating value.
h:
“Success is about creating value.” —
Candice Carpenter

q: The time is now, the place is here. Stay in the present.
h:
“The time is now, the place is here. Stay in the present.” —
Dan Millman

q: I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.
h:
“I didn't get there by wishing for it or hoping for it, but by working for it.” —
Estee Lauder

q: Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.
h:
“Failure is not fatal, but failure to change might be.” —
John Wooden

q: A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.
h:
“A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Anything becomes interesting if you look at it long enough..
h:
“Anything becomes interesting if you look at it long enough..” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: Everybody has talent, but ability takes hard work.
h:
“Everybody has talent, but ability takes hard work.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
h:
“Turn your wounds into wisdom. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Death is not sad; the sad thing is that most people don't really live at all.
h:
“Death is not sad; the sad thing is that most people don't really live at all.” —
Dan Millman

q: You can't go forward and backwards at the same time.
h:
“You can't go forward and backwards at the same time.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
h:
“Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand - relax.
h:
“Don't seek, don't search, don't ask, don't knock, don't demand - relax.” —
Osho

q: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
h:
“If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.
h:
“Emancipate yourself from mental slavery, none but ourselves can free our mind.” —
Bob Marley

q: Meditate. It won't be fun but it will surface what you need to deal with.
h:
“Meditate. It won't be fun but it will surface what you need to deal with.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.
h:
“Your first and foremost job as a leader is to take charge of your own energy and then help to orchestrate the energy of those around you.” —
Peter Drucker

q: If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.
h:
“If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.” —
Criss Jami

q: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.
h:
“Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
h:
“Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack. ” —
Seneca

q: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
h:
“The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.” —
Colin R. Davis

q: I don't pretend to know everything; I just only speak on matters I know I'll win.
h:
“I don't pretend to know everything; I just only speak on matters I know I'll win.” —
Criss Jami

q: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
h:
“One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Life is a traveling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
h:
“Life is a traveling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
h:
“Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.” —
Judy Garland

q: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.

q: Fear is what stops you. Courage is what keeps you going.
h:

h:

h:

q: Family not only needs to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also of those whom we'd give blood.

q: Trust, like the soul, never returns once it is gone.

q: Change begets change. Nothing propagates so fast.
h:

q: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other.

q: I cannot make my days longer so I strive to make them better.
h:

q: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.

q: It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be.

q: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.

q: Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.

q: The deeper the truth in a creative work, the longer it will live.

q: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.

q: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.

q: It is easy to discover what another has discovered before.

q: It is not that we have too little time to do all the things we need to do , it is that we feel the need to do too many things in the time we have.

h:

q: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.

h:

q: It is not what we get. But who we become, what we contribute... that gives meaning to our lives.

q: The wisest men follow their own direction.

h:

q: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.

q: Quiet people have the loudest minds.

q: Age is a very high price to pay for maturity.

q: Life is trying things to see if they work.

q: Life is much like going to the gym. The most painful part is deciding to go. Once you get past that, it's easy.

q: The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.

q: We have a choice everyday regarding the attitude we will embrace for that day.

q: If you look for perfection, you'll never be content.

q: If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it is lethal.

q: If I love myself I love you. If I love you I love myself.

q: Any fool can turn a blind eye but who knows what the ostrich sees in the sand.
